00046         template <class T>
00047         struct RemoveReference
00048         {
00049             typedef T Type;
00050             typedef const T ConstType;
00051         };
00052 
00053         template <class T>
00054         struct RemoveReference<T&>
00055         {
00056             typedef T Type;
00057             typedef const T ConstType;
00058         };
00059 
00060         template <class T>
00061         struct RemoveReference<const T&>
00062         {
00063             typedef T Type;
00064             typedef const T ConstType;
00065         };
00066 
00067         // This union is declared outside the horrible_cast because BCC 5.5.1
00068         // can't inline a function with a nested class, and gives a warning.
00069         template <class OutputClass, class InputClass>
00070         union THorribleUnion{
00071             OutputClass out;
00072             InputClass in;
00073         };
00074 
00075 #ifdef WIN32
00076 
00077         template <class OutputClass, class InputClass>
00078         inline OutputClass HorribleCast(const InputClass input){
00079             THorribleUnion<OutputClass, InputClass> u;
00080             // Cause a compile-time error if in, out and u are not the same size.
00081             // If the compile fails here, it means the compiler has peculiar
00082             // unions which would prevent the cast from working.
00083             typedef int ERROR_CantUseHorrible_cast[sizeof(InputClass)==sizeof(u) 
00084                 && sizeof(InputClass)==sizeof(OutputClass) ? 1 : -1];
00085             u.in = input;
00086             return u.out;
00087         }
00088 
00089         //*************************************************************************
00090         // Because some compiler still do not support TR1, so i create one for it
00091         //*************************************************************************
00092         template <class T> class SmartPtr
00093         {
00094         public:
00095             // Constructors
00096             SmartPtr()
00097             {
00098                 ptr = NULL;
00099                 count = new int;
00100                 *count = 1;
00101             }
00102 
00103             SmartPtr(const SmartPtr<T> &original)
00104             {
00105                 ptr = original.ptr;
00106                 count = original.count;
00107                 (*count)++;
00108             }
00109 
00110             SmartPtr(T* original)
00111             {
00112                 ptr = original;
00113                 count = new int;
00114                 *count = 1;
00115             }
00116 
00117             ~SmartPtr()
00118             {
00119                 Release();
00120             }
00121 
00122 
00123             //assignment
00124             SmartPtr<T> &operator=(const SmartPtr &rhs)
00125             {
00126                 if (this == &rhs)
00127                     return *this;
00128 
00129                 Release();
00130                 ptr = rhs.ptr;
00131                 count = rhs.count;
00132                 Acquire();
00133 
00134                 return *this;
00135             }
00136 
00137             SmartPtr<T> &operator=(const T* rhs)
00138             {
00139                 if (ptr == rhs)
00140                     return *this;
00141 
00142                 Release();
00143                 ptr = rhs;
00144                 count = new int;
00145                 *count = 1;
00146             }
00147             //Use
00148             T* operator->()
00149             {
00150                 return ptr;
00151             }
00152 
00153         private:
00154             T* ptr;
00155             int* count;
00156 
00157             void Acquire()
00158             {
00159                 (*count)++;
00160             }
00161 
00162             void Release()
00163             {
00164                 (*count)--;
00165                 if (!(*count))
00166                 {
00167                     delete count;
00168 
00169                     if (ptr)
00170                         delete ptr;
00171 
00172                     ptr = NULL;
00173                 }
00174 
00175             }
00176             // Comparison
00177             bool operator>(const SmartPtr<T> &rhs)
00178             {
00179                 return this>&rhs;
00180             }
00181         };
00182 
00183 #define AmopSharedPtr Detail::SmartPtr
00184 #endif

00190         struct GnuMFP
00191         {
00192             union
00193             {
00194                 void* funcadr;
00195                 int vtable_index_2; // = vindex*2+1, always odd
00196             };
00197             int delta;
00198         };
00199 
00200         template <class OutputClass, class InputClass>
00201         inline OutputClass HorribleCast(const InputClass input){
00202             THorribleUnion<GnuMFP, InputClass> u;
00203             // Cause a compile-time error if in, out and u are not the same size.
00204             // If the compile fails here, it means the compiler has peculiar
00205             // unions which would prevent the cast from working.
00206             typedef int ERROR_CantUseHorrible_cast[sizeof(InputClass)==sizeof(u) 
00207                 && sizeof(InputClass)==sizeof(GnuMFP) ? 1 : -1];
00208             u.in = input;
00209             return u.out.funcadr;
00210         }
